--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, Linda Larsson <enma_o@y...> wrote:
> Hello! Newbie here <bows> Glad to have joined, there seem to be 
such a lot of knowledgeable people around.
>  
> As such, I have a few questions, or rather a few things I'd like 
to have confirmed/dismissed, on what I've read so far about 
Hijikata's early life. (I have a special fondness for him - all the 
Shinsengumi boys are interesting, but this one's special!)

Hello, Linda-san. I am momoiro-usagi. 
I am also Hijikata's fan.
I am very happy that I can meet foreign Hijikata's fan. 

Although the answer of M-san is very detailed, the mistake in some 
exists.
Please let me correct only a few. 


 
> This is what I've found so far:
> -Full name: Hijikata Toshizou Yoshitoyo. (Anyone know if he had 
another childhood name, or if he ever changed it later in life?)

He used the name of Naitou Hayato for the period from 
Kouyouchinbutai to Nagareyama as a retainer of Tokugawa government. 
I think that the name which he used except Hijikata Toshizou is only 
this name. 



> - He was the youngest of 6 children, and had 3 brothers and 2 
sisters. The younger sister's name was Onobu (she later married Sato 
Hikogorou). I read somewhere that the oldest brother's name was 
Kiroku, and the Shinsengumi! NHK series gives another brother's name 
as Tamajirou. 
>  
> - According to one site, both his parents died when he was very 
young (IIRC it even said that his father was already dead by the 
time Toshizou was born). The older of his sisters also died early.

He is ten brothers' youngest child. 
Since four of children of it died early very much, record hardly 
exists. 
Other brothers are Tamejirou, Kiroku, Shuu, Daisaku, and Nobu. 
(When calling a female name a long time ago, "O" was attached on the 
name. Onobu is the name called courteously and her true name is Nobu.
By the way, what information is Otoku? M-san.
I looked at it for the first time. ) 

The top elder brother is Tamejirou. 
Properly speaking, he was the inheritor of Hijikata house, but he 
was a blind person by nature. 
(The physically handicapped person was not able to become an 
inheritor at the time.) 
Therefore, the second elder brother's Kiroku inherited Hijikata 
house.
The older elder sister is Shuu. 
She has died of an illness at the age of 16, when Toshizou is 3 
years old. 
The third elder brother's Daisaku became a doctor's adopted child, 
and became a name of Kasuya Ryojyun. 
A younger elder sister's Nobu often looked after Toshizou. 
She married Satou Hikogorou who is a cousin.
Masa which is the mother of Hikogorou was the sister of the father 
of Nobu.
Masa wished marriage of Nobu and Hikogorou.

These are their age in 1835 when Toshizou was born. 
Tamejirou was 24 years old, Kiroku was 17 years old, Shuu was 13 
years old, Daisaku was 8 years old, and Nobu was 5 years old. 
(Here, Kazoedoshi is used.) 

The father of Toshizou is Yoshiatsu (Hayato). 
He died, several months before Toshizou was born. 
Moreover, Etsu of the mother of Toshizou died of an illness, when he 
was 6 years old. 



> - Toshizou was raised first by his brother Kiroku, then moved to 
Onobu's home at the age of 11. This was also the time he lost his 
first job, through being disrespectful to his employer.

Toshizou found a job at the big kimono store of Edo at the age of 
11. 
However, he quarreled with the boss and has retired immediately. 
The store at which he found a job at the time is Matsuzakaya in 
Ueno. 
(It was a name of Itou-Gofukuten at the time.) 
Although this store exists even now, it is a very high-class store. 
I think that Kiroku suffered troubles very much in order to make 
Toshizou find a job at this store. 
(I think that he tried to look for a place of work good for a 
younger brother as parents' substitute.) 
Toshizou betrayed the expectation. 
Possibly he was hard to return to the house of Kiroku. 
He was in Satou's house rather than Hijikata's house in many cases. 
(Satou Hikogorou is a very stouthearted person and got along well 
with Toshizou.) 



> - I understand he got to know (the future) Kondou Isami when they 
were both in their late teens. Sources differ on whether he joined 
the Tennen Rishin ryuu at this time, and simply didn't become a 
*resident* student until later, or if he didn't in fact join until 
he was 28 (I think that's the right age).

Satou Hikogorou had Dojyo in the house, in order to study Tennen 
Rishin Ryuu. 
Kondou came there and was teaching the art of fencing. 
It is not known about what time Toshizou went into Tennen Rishin 
Ryuu. 
"Ryouyuden" written by Kojima Shikanosuke who is the relative of 
Toshizou is writing that Toshizou went into Tennen Rishin Ryuu at 
the age of 17. 
However, there is no name of Toshizou in the data of the time of a 
Tennen Rishin Ryuu side. 
It is 1859 years that Toshizou went into it formally. 
Toshizou was 25 years old. 
However, admission by this age is too slow as a swordsman. 
Therefore, many researchers are surmising that it was distant from 
there for some reasons, after he goes into Tennen Rishin Ryuu at the 
age of 17. 



> - He lost another job at 17, this time he was working at a 
clothing store, and got fired for sleeping with one of his female co-
workers. It was after this that his brother in law helped him set 
himself up as a medicine peddler. 
>  
> So... right, wrong, what?

Mostly, it is a correct answer.^^ 
Toshizou failed in the problem with a woman. 
It was scolded by Satou Hikogorou and he solved this problem by his 
own power. 
Toshizou had a medicinal box and the tool of the art of fencing, and 
went out for sale of medicine. 
And when Dojyo of the art of fencing was found, he had the art of 
fencing taught to the occasion which sells medicine by the Dojyo. 
The form of various sword styles was mixed with his sword. 
He has not got Menkyo (license) of Tennen Rishin Ryuu. 
It is said that it is because Kondo Syuusai did not regard the sword 
style which he mixed as good. 



> Oh, and a bonus question <grins> Does anyone know much about the 
relationship between Hijikata and Okita Souji? Most sources I've 
found mention how the original Shieikan four were "like brothers"... 
but two people I've debated with (admitted, people who really 
dislike the way Shinsengumi manga/anime tend to turn those two into 
a couple) claim that it's "well known" that Hijikata and Okita 
didn't get along. Which, granted, isn't exactly antithetic to their 
being foster brothers - you should see my family! - but I wondered 
if anyone could shed some light on the topic.

I'm sorry, since he does not understand your question well, I may 
answer that it is different. 
(I can read English only with translation software.) 

It is a fiction that Hijikata and Okita were good friends like 
brothers. 
Of course, they may have been good friends. 
However, such their relation cannot be found out in existing 
documents. 

As for the relation of them who appear in Manga/Anime, the many are 
based on the novel of Siba Ryotarou rather than the historical fact. 
The novel of Shiba made the boom of Shinsengumi.
However, the image of Shiba-Shinsengumi has also been created 
together with it. 

Although Kondo has charisma nature and is a benevolent person, he is 
simple and foolish. 
Hijikata is a cool and cruel man good at a stratagem. 
Okita is a clean young man like a child, and has cruel character. 
Okita adores Hijikata very much and often tries to tease him. 
These are the images of Shiba-Shinsengumi rather than them of a 
historical fact. 
That Okita appeared as a beautiful young man, "Moeyo Ken" of Shiba 
novel was the very first. 
 



Since a Taiga drama differs from Shinsengumi of a historical fact, 
there are people who say bad. 
However, their opinion is often carried out based on Shiba-
Shinsengumi. lol
It is a strange talk. Both of these are fictions. 
Distinction of the fact and a fiction is difficult for the history 
of Shinsengumi. 
Or there are people who assert the opinion by the partial belief 
among researchers. 
And it exists in the network, without verifying it. 

I think that the person who introduced the Shinsengumi research 
document to Sec is probably worried about it. 
The authors of books whom he introduced are people who have a track 
record not as a Shinsengumi researcher but as a Bakumatsu historian.

momoiro-usagi
